cheatsheet.title: Create a new numerical correlation analysis

intro.description: This type of analysis examines correlations between nominal and interval columns and returns the results in a bubble chart.

item.title: Set the analysis metadata
item.description: To open the Create New Analysis wizard, right click the Analyses folder on the DQ Repository tree view and select New Analysis. Browse to and select Numerical Correlation Analysis in the wizard (or click the link below). The wizard prompts you to provide the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description...). Upon completion, an editor opens in which you can define the analysis settings.

item.title: Select the columns to analyze
item.description: In the editor, click Analyzed Columns (or click the link below). Then click Select columns to open a dialog box in which you can browse to and select the nominal and interval columns to analyze. Alternatively, you can drop the columns from the DQ Repository tree view onto the Analyzed Columns box in the editor.

item.title: Select the right data mining type
item.description: Next to each column, there is a corresponding Data Mining Type box. Select the relevant data mining type from the list.

item.title: Analyze
item.description: To execute the analysis, click the Run icon located to the top left of the editor. Alternatively, right click the analysis under the Analyses folder on the DQ Repository view and then select the Run icon (or click the link below).
